alert.note: Alert for Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 5:11PM PST until December 11 at 10:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph resulting in blowing snow. * WHERE...Lincoln County including Caliente, Pioche, and Panaca. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and dangerous due to slick and snow covered roadways. Blowing snow may result in visibility reductions. Some spots along Highway 93 may see accumulating snowfall near Caliente and north of Pioche. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor snowfall of less than 3 inches is possible in Lincoln County at elevations below 5000 feet.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
